item.title: Functional Programming for laymen, a perhaps unexplored perspective
item.description: The core of my argument is that good functional programming requires more working memory on behalf of the operator than equivalent procedural programs. The introduction of state, which can be thought of as materializations of the events processed by the system works well with how most people model their worlds. Humans operate on a materialized view My wallet has a balance of 20 dollars. It isn’t a wallet with a 12.
